heading: rants & raves
subheading: date: fri, 03 dec 1999 14:45:11 -0800 to: newsfeedback@wired.com from: eric marcoullier (eric@marcoullier.com) subject: and you think reporting is fun your story about the microsoft press conference didn’t come close to qualifying as journalism (“and you think reporting is fun,” 3.dec.99). i’ve been in the net industry for more than seven years and more often […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: fri, 03 dec 1999 14:45:11 -0800 to: newsfeedback@wired.comfrom: eric marcoullier (eric@marcoullier.com)subject: and you think reporting is funyour story about the microsoft press conference didn't come close to qualifying as journalism ("and you think reporting is fun," 3.dec.99). i've been in the net industry for more than seven years and more often than not, media presentations are as bad or worse than the one written about in this "article."i can only assume that you chose to publish this account, instead of any of the thousands of dull meetings over the past few years, out of some malice towards microsoft.wired news is the only site that i visit every day – please don't make me go elsewhere to seek reasonable, newsworthy information about the internet.
